intro: Hieracium integrifolium subsp. coloratipes, commonly known as the red-stemmed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The subspecies is distinguished by its reddish stems and leaves with smooth, entire margins. It typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. The plant produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators.
